notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.
ariaRetry: Retry the task. You can improve your previous answer if the author allowed that.
taskDescription: A store declares a deep discount of 40% for an item, which they say will save $30. What was the original price of the item?
detailedSolution:
We want the original price of the item, which is the total. We know the percent, 40, and the percentage of the total, $30. To find the original cost, use <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>100</mn>
      <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
      <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
      <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mi>x</mi>
      </mrow>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi>n</mi>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{100\,\times \,{x}}}{{n}}</annotation></semantics></math>, with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>x</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>30</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">x = 30</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>n</mi>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> = </mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>40</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">n\,{\text{ = }}\,{\text{40}}</annotation></semantics></math>. Calculating with those values yields <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mfrac>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>100</mn>
      <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
      <mo>×<!-- × --></mo>
      <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
      <mn>30</mn>
    </mrow>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mn>40</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mfrac>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mspace width="thinmathspace"></mspace>
  <mn>75</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\frac{{100\, \times \,30}}{{40}}\, = \,75</annotation></semantics></math>. So, the original was $75.
